intro: Majovskya sudetica, commonly known as the Sudeten majovskya, is a rare flowering plant native to the Czech Republic and parts of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in open woodlands and meadows. It has small, white to pale yellow flowers and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
